description:
Lightweight APM dashboard for monitoring OpenTelemetry-based services.  

Instrument your applications using OpenTelemetry SDKs and send traces, metrics, and logs to [Tempo](https://grafana.com/oss/tempo/) for traces, a Prometheus-compatible database like [Mimir](https://grafana.com/oss/mimir/) for metrics, and [Loki](https://grafana.com/oss/loki/) for logs. This dashboard provides a centralized view of your application's health and performance.  

For a fully managed observability stack, consider using [Grafana Cloud](https://grafana.com/products/cloud/).  

Learn more about this dashboard [here](https://github.com/cyrille-leclerc/opentelemetry-service-dashboard).

panels.description: Shows the timestamp of the latest metrics received, the `target_info` metric.
panels.title: Latest metrics received

panels.description:
HTTP endpoints aggregation on the `http.server.request.duration` metric.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration
panels.title: Duration

panels.description:
HTTP endpoints aggregation on the `http.server.request.duration` metric. 

Errors are identified by   `http.response.status_code=~"5.."`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration

targets.expr: (sum without(http_response_status_code, error_type, instance) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{job="$service_namespace/$service_name", http_response_status_code=~"5.."}[$__rate_interval])) * 100) / sum without(http_response_status_code, error_type, instance) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{job="$service_namespace/$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Error

panels.description:
HTTP endpoints aggregation on the `http.server.request.duration` metric.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration
panels.title: Request Rate

panels.description:
gRPC endpoints aggregation based on the `rpc.server.duration` metric.

Errors are identified by `rpc.grpc.status_code != 0` which make the panel specific to the gRPC protocol.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/rpc/rpc-metrics/#metric-rpcserverdurationInbound
panels.title: Error

panels.description:
gRPC endpoints aggregation on the  `rpc.server.duration` metric.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/rpc/rpc-metrics/#metric-rpcserverduration
panels.title: Request Rate

panels.description:
Inbound HTTP operations of the service (aka HTTP endpoints) based on the `http.server.request.duration` metric.

Errors are identified by `http.response.status_code=~"5.."`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration

targets.expr:
(
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name", http_response_status_code=~"5.."}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
            )
        )
    )

panels.title: HTTP Operations

panels.description:
Inbound gRPC operations of the service (aka gRPC endpoints) based on the `rpc.server.request.duration` metric.

Errors are identified by `rpc.grpc.status_code != 0` which make the panel specific to the gRPC protocol.

https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/rpc/rpc-metrics/#metric-rpcserverduration

targets.expr:
(
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(rpc_server_duration_milliseconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name", rpc_grpc_status_code!="0"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                "/",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(rpc_server_duration_milliseconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                "/",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(rpc_server_duration_milliseconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                "/",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
            )
        )
    )

panels.title: gRPC Operations

panels.description:
HTTP calls made by the service based on the `http.client.request.duration` metric.

Calls broken done by remote `server.address` and by `http.request.method`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpclientrequestduration

targets.expr:
(
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_client_request_duration_seconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name", http_response_status_code=~"5.."}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                " ",
                "server_address",
                "http_request_method",
                "url_template"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_client_request_duration_seconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                " ",
                "server_address",
                "http_request_method",
                "url_template"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_client_request_duration_seconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                " ",
                "server_address",
                "http_request_method",
                "url_template"
            )
        )
    )

panels.title: Outbound HTTP Services

panels.description:
DB calls made by the service based on the `db.client.operation.duration` metric.

Calls broken down by `server.address` and `db.namespace`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/database/database-metrics/#metric-dbclientoperationduration

targets.expr:
(
        sum by (database) (
            label_join(
                rate(db_client_operation_duration_seconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name", http_response_status_code=~"5.."}[$__rate_interval]),
                "database",
                "/",
                "server_address",
                "db_namespace"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (database) (
            label_join(
                rate(db_client_operation_duration_seconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "database",
                "/",
                "server_address",
                "db_namespace"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (database) (
            label_join(
                rate(db_client_operation_duration_seconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "database",
                "/",
                "server_address",
                "db_namespace"
            )
        )
    )

panels.title: Outbound Databases

panels.description:
gRPC calls made by the service based on the `rpc.client.request.duration` metric.

Specific to gRPC due to the usage of the `grpc.status.code` attribute to identify errors.

Calls broken down by `server.address`, `rpc.service`, and `rpc.method`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/rpc/rpc-metrics/#rpc-client

targets.expr:
(
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(rpc_client_duration_milliseconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name", http_response_status_code=~"5.."}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                "/",
                "server_address",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(rpc_client_duration_milliseconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                "/",
                "server_address",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(rpc_client_duration_milliseconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                "/",
                "server_address",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
            )
        )
    )

panels.title: Outbound gRPC Services

panels.description:
Logs of the service, filtered by `service.name` and `service.namespace`.

To explore the logs, open the menu clicking on the icon `` of this panel and click on `Explore`.
Traces containing a span emitted by the service

For JVM based services like Java or Kotlin, the JVM metrics.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/runtime/jvm-metrics/
panels.title: JVM

list.description: Values instrospected from traces, filtering on the selected service namespace..
list.label: service.name
list.name: service_name

title: Lightweight APM for OpenTelemetry
